original: @129b # // rgya gar skad du //
analyzed: @129b # // rgya gar skad du //
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: tsanda ma h'a ro sha na s'a dha nam /
analyzed: tsanda ma h'a ro sha na s'a dha nam /
translated: Canda-Mahāroṣaṇa-sādhana

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: gtum po chen po'i sgrub thabs /
analyzed: gtum po chen po'i sgrub thabs /
translated: The Means of Accomplishing the Great Fierce One

original: khro bo'i rgyal po mi g-yo ba la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: khro bo'i rgyal po mi g-yo ba la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the king of wrathful ones, Acala.

original: rnal 'byor pas yid dang mthun pa'i gnas 'ga' zhig tu stan bde ba la nye bar 'dug ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas yid dang mthun pa'i gnas 'ga' zhig tu stan bde ba la nye bar 'dug ste /
translated: The yogī, in some place that is pleasing to the mind, should sit on a comfortable seat.

original: rang gi snying gar nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du h'um yig nag po blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi snying gar nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du h'um yig nag po blta bar bya'o //
translated: In one's heart, one should visualize a black syllable hūṃ upon a sun maṇḍala.

original: de'i 'od zer gyi bla ma dang / sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams gdan drangs te nam mkha' la rnam par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'od zer gyi bla ma dang / sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams gdan drangs te nam mkha' la rnam par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Light rays from that invite the gurus, buddhas, and bodhisattvas, which one should view in the sky.

original: de nas h'um yig las 'od zer byung ste me tog la sogs pa nyer spyod lngas de rnams la yang dag par mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas h'um yig las 'od zer byung ste me tog la sogs pa nyer spyod lngas de rnams la yang dag par mchod par bya'o //
translated: Then, light rays emerge from the syllable hūṃ and with the five offerings such as flowers, one should make perfect offerings to them.

original: de rnams kyi mdun du sdig pa bshags pa dang / bsod nams la rjes su yi rang ba dang / bsod nams yongs su bsngo ba la sogs pa rnams bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi mdun du sdig pa bshags pa dang / bsod nams la rjes su yi rang ba dang / bsod nams yongs su bsngo ba la sogs pa rnams bya'o //
translated: In front of them, one should confess one’s evil deeds, rejoice in the merit, and dedicate the merit.

original: de nas byams pa ni sems can thams cad la bu gcig pa bzhin du dga' ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de nas byams pa ni sems can thams cad la bu gcig pa bzhin du dga' ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Then, loving kindness is the characteristic of delighting in all sentient beings as if they were one’s only child.

original: snying rje ni sdug bsngal dang sdug bsngal gyi rgyur gyur pa rnams yang dag par gdon par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: snying rje ni sdug bsngal dang sdug bsngal gyi rgyur gyur pa rnams yang dag par gdon par 'dod pa'o //
translated: Compassion is the desire to completely remove suffering and the causes of suffering.

original: de la rab tu dga' ba'i gzugs ni dga' ba'o //
analyzed: de la rab tu dga' ba'i gzugs ni dga' ba'o //
translated: Joy is the form of delight in that.

original: btang snyoms ni dam pa ma yin pa'i nyes pa yongs su zhi ba'i rang bzhin du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: btang snyoms ni dam pa ma yin pa'i nyes pa yongs su zhi ba'i rang bzhin du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Equanimity should be cultivated as the nature of the complete pacification of non-virtuous faults.

original: de nas khams gsum po stong pa nyid du rnam par bltas nas sngags 'dis byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas khams gsum po stong pa nyid du rnam par bltas nas sngags 'dis byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: Then, having contemplated the three realms as emptiness, one should bless with this mantra:

original: aom sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra sva bh'a wa a'atma ko& ham /
analyzed: aom sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra sva bh'a wa a'atma ko& ham /
translated: Oṃ śūnyatā-jñāna-vajra-svabhāvātmako ’haṃ

original: de nas bar snang la padma'i steng du nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i h'um yig las byung ba'i ral gri'i @130a * //
analyzed: de nas bar snang la padma'i steng du nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i h'um yig las byung ba'i ral gri'i @130a * //
translated: Then, in space, upon a lotus and sun disk, one should visualize oneself as Acala, fierce and blazing, with a sword arisen from the syllable HŪM,

original: chang par h'um yig gnas pa'i bdag nyid yongs su gyur pa las mi g-yo ba gtum po'i skur blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: chang par h'um yig gnas pa'i bdag nyid yongs su gyur pa las mi g-yo ba gtum po'i skur blta bar bya'o //
translated: with a HŪM syllable in the hilt of the sword, and transformed from the syllable HŪM.

original: zlum zhing dmar la 'bar ba'i khro bo'i spyan bgrad pa /🔽dpral bar khro gnyer bsdus pa //
analyzed: zlum zhing dmar la 'bar ba'i khro bo'i spyan bgrad pa / dpral bar khro gnyer bsdus pa //
translated: He is round, red, and blazing, with fierce, staring eyes.🔽His brow is furrowed in anger.

original: ya sos ma mchu bsdams pa /
analyzed: ya sos ma mchu bsdams pa /
translated: His upper lip is drawn up by his fangs.

original: pus mo g-yon pa sa la btsugs pa /
analyzed: pus mo g-yon pa sa la btsugs pa /
translated: His left knee is on the ground.

original: zhabs g-yas pas bdud gdug pa can gnon pa /
analyzed: zhabs g-yas pas bdud gdug pa can gnon pa /
translated: His right foot tramples on the wicked Māra.

original: phyag g-yas pas ral gri bsnams pa /
analyzed: phyag g-yas pas ral gri bsnams pa /
translated: His right hand holds a sword.

original: g-yon pa khu tshur sdigs mdzub dang bcas pa'i zhags pas srid pa gsum gyi 'jigs pa 'joms pa /
analyzed: g-yon pa khu tshur sdigs mdzub dang bcas pa'i zhags pas srid pa gsum gyi 'jigs pa 'joms pa /
translated: His left hand, in a threatening fist, holds a noose that destroys the fear of the three worlds.

original: aindra n'i la dang mtshungs pa'i 'od zer can /
analyzed: aindra n'i la dang mtshungs pa'i 'od zer can /
translated: He has the radiance of sapphire.

original: me 'bar ba'i gtum po chen po'o //
analyzed: me 'bar ba'i gtum po chen po'o //
translated: He is a great fierce blazing fire.

original: de nas snying ga'i sa bon gyi 'od zer gyis ye shes sems dpa' bkug nas dam tshig sems dpa' la rab tu bcug ste /
analyzed: de nas snying ga'i sa bon gyi 'od zer gyis ye shes sems dpa' bkug nas dam tshig sems dpa' la rab tu bcug ste /
translated: Then, having summoned the gnosis being with light rays from the seed syllable at the heart, one should cause him to enter into the commitment being.

original: dbang bskur blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: dbang bskur blang bar bya'o //
translated: One should take the empowerment.

original: dbang bskur ba'i mthar spyi bor mi bskyod par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: dbang bskur ba'i mthar spyi bor mi bskyod par blta bar bya'o //
translated: At the conclusion of the empowerment, one should see Akṣobhya on the crown.

original: de nas bsgoms pas ngal na sngags bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas bsgoms pas ngal na sngags bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Then, if one is tired of meditating, one should recite the mantra.

original: de la sngags ni 'di'o //
analyzed: de la sngags ni 'di'o //
translated: The mantra is this:

original: aom tsanda ma h'a ro sha na h'um phat /
analyzed: aom tsanda ma h'a ro sha na h'um phat /
translated: Oṃ caṇḍamahāroṣaṇa hūṃ phaṭ.

original: gtum po chen po'i sgrub thabs rdzogs so//
analyzed: gtum po chen po'i sgrub thabs rdzogs so//
translated: The sādhana of Caṇḍa Mahāroṣaṇa is complete.
